articles.headline: Driving Is Down, but Auto Insurance Rates Are Rising
articles.snippet: The reduced driving has not yet shown up as fewer accidents, and meanwhile, other factors are driving up the overall cost of claims, insurance companies say.
articles.abstract: The reduced driving has not yet shown up as fewer accidents, and meanwhile, other factors are driving up the overall cost of claims, insurance companies say.
articles.lead_paragraph: Gasoline prices are well above last year’s levels, and people are driving less. That would suggest fewer crashes, and a little relief for the struggling American consumer, in the form of lower auto insurance premiums.

articles.headline: Socially Responsible, With Egg on Its Face
articles.snippet: Many are wondering how one of the oldest practitioners in the field of socially responsible investing got mixed up with companies involved with alcohol, gambling and military contracting.
articles.abstract: Many are wondering how one of the oldest practitioners in the field of socially responsible investing got mixed up with companies involved with alcohol, gambling and military contracting.
articles.lead_paragraph: When the news broke late last month, it read almost like satire. The Securities and Exchange Commission had charged a mutual fund company that specialized in socially responsible investments with taking stakes in companies involved with alcohol, gambling and military contracting.

articles.headline: A Mission Goes Off Course
articles.snippet: Whenever the mortgage finance giants, Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac, find themselves in a tough spot, they always seem to find a way to blame their problems on “the mission.”
articles.abstract: Whenever the mortgage finance giants, Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac, find themselves in a tough spot, they always seem to find a way to blame their problems on “the mission.”
articles.lead_paragraph: Whenever the mortgage finance giants, Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac, find themselves in a tough spot  and boy, are they in a tough spot now!  they always seem to find a way to blame their problems on “the mission.” “We exist to expand affordable housing,” says Fannie Mae on its Web site, and although it also lists its other mission  providing liquidity for the American housing market  it is the former that has long been the companies’ trump card.

articles.headline: After Pullout, Russia Envisions Long-Term Shift
articles.snippet: It is becoming clearer that Moscow has no intention of restoring what was, on the ground or diplomatically.
articles.abstract: It is becoming clearer that Moscow has no intention of restoring what was, on the ground or diplomatically.
articles.lead_paragraph: MOSCOW — As the Russian Army withdrew most of its forces from Georgia, it was becoming ever more clear on Friday that Moscow had no intention of restoring what once was — either on the ground or diplomatically.

articles.headline: Rabbis Debate Kosher Ethics at Meat Plant
articles.snippet: An immigration raid has raised interest in an effort to create wage and safety standards for workers producing kosher food.
articles.abstract: An immigration raid has raised interest in an effort to create wage and safety standards for workers producing kosher food.
articles.lead_paragraph: An immigration raid at the nation’s largest kosher meatpacking plant has opened a wide rift among Jewish leaders over the company’s ethical conduct and led to new interest in a campaign to create wage and safety standards for workers producing kosher food.

articles.headline: More Flights Are Overbooked, but Payoffs Are Rising
articles.snippet: The chance of losing your seat may be higher this fall, but airlines are offering more compensation.
articles.abstract: The chance of losing your seat may be higher this fall, but airlines are offering more compensation.
articles.lead_paragraph: The bad news: the likelihood that travelers will be bumped from an overbooked flight may grow worse this fall when airlines shrink their fleets to cut unprofitable flights and inefficient planes, meaning even fewer empty seats than there are now.
articles.byline: By Micheline Maynard and Michelle Higgins

articles.headline: For McCains, a Public Path but Private Wealth
articles.snippet: With the McCains’ money in Cindy McCain’s name, John McCain’s finances are hard to assess. But a clearer picture has emerged from records and interviews.
articles.abstract: With the McCains’ money in Cindy McCain’s name, John McCain’s finances are hard to assess. But a clearer picture has emerged from records and interviews.
articles.lead_paragraph: PHOENIX  When Senator John McCain is in Washington, he lives in a luxury high-rise condominium in Arlington, Va., owned by his wife, Cindy Hensley McCain. Mrs. McCain also owns their condos in Phoenix, San Diego and Coronado, Calif., and their vacation compound near Sedona, Ariz. And it is the beer business, Hensley & Company, she inherited from her father that is the source of the McCain family fortune.

articles.headline: Automakers to Seek More Money for Retooling Vehicle Plants
articles.snippet: The steep decline in vehicle sales and rapid shift in the market to smaller cars has prompted three automakers to seek a significant increase in a government loan program.
articles.abstract: The steep decline in vehicle sales and rapid shift in the market to smaller cars has prompted three automakers to seek a significant increase in a government loan program.
articles.lead_paragraph: DETROIT  The steep decline in vehicle sales and rapid shift in the market to smaller cars has prompted General Motors, Ford Motor and Chrysler to seek a significant increase in the $25 billion government loan program authorized last year to help them build more fuel-efficient vehicles.
articles.byline: By Nick Bunkley and Bill Vlasic

articles.headline: Field Narrows for Obama’s Running Mate
articles.snippet: Barack Obama told two of his top three prospects that he would not be choosing them, officials said, feeding a consensus in the party that he had chosen Senator Joseph R. Biden Jr.
articles.abstract: Barack Obama told two of his top three prospects that he would not be choosing them, officials said, feeding a consensus in the party that he had chosen Senator Joseph R. Biden Jr.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  Senator Barack Obama informed two of his top three vice-presidential prospects Friday night that he would not be choosing them, Democratic officials said, encouraging a consensus within the party that he had settled on Senator Joseph R. Biden Jr. of Delaware.
articles.byline: By Adam Nagourney and Jeff Zeleny

articles.headline: With Oil Demand Down, Prices Are Leveling Off
articles.snippet: A combination of weak economic growth, slowing demand and shifting perceptions has sent oil prices down 21 percent from last month’s peak.
articles.abstract: A combination of weak economic growth, slowing demand and shifting perceptions has sent oil prices down 21 percent from last month’s peak.
articles.lead_paragraph: Until recently, it seemed that oil prices could move in only one direction: up. But in the last few weeks, the great energy rally that kicked off at the beginning of the decade has shown signs of running out of steam.

articles.headline: Uncertainty Over Fannie and Freddie
articles.snippet: Anxiously awaiting a move by the Treasury Department and spurned by large investment firms, Freddie Mac and Fannie Mae find themselves unable to raise capital.
articles.abstract: Anxiously awaiting a move by the Treasury Department and spurned by large investment firms, Freddie Mac and Fannie Mae find themselves unable to raise capital.
articles.lead_paragraph: Anxiously awaiting a move by the Treasury Department and spurned by large investment firms, Freddie Mac and Fannie Mae find themselves unable to raise capital and with little ability to maneuver.
articles.byline: By Charles Duhigg and Vikas Bajaj

articles.headline: Obama Chooses Biden as Running Mate
articles.snippet: Word of Senator Barack Obama’s decision leaked out hours after he had informed Senator Evan Bayh of Indiana and Gov. Tim Kaine of Virginia that they had not been chosen.
articles.abstract: Word of Senator Barack Obama’s decision leaked out hours after he had informed Senator Evan Bayh of Indiana and Gov. Tim Kaine of Virginia that they had not been chosen.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  Senator Barack Obama has chosen Senator Joseph R. Biden Jr. of Delaware to be his running mate, turning to a leading authority on foreign policy and a longtime Washington hand to fill out the Democratic ticket, Mr. Obama announced in text and e-mail messages early Saturday.
articles.byline: By Adam Nagourney and Jeff Zeleny

articles.headline: In the Central Valley, the Ruins of the Housing Bust
articles.snippet: The experience of Merced, Calif., suggests that recovery from the national real estate debacle will be painful and protracted.
articles.abstract: The experience of Merced, Calif., suggests that recovery from the national real estate debacle will be painful and protracted.
articles.lead_paragraph: MERCED, Calif.

articles.headline: A Senate Stalwart Who Bounced Back
articles.snippet: After enduring a period of tumult in 1987, when he dropped a bid for president, Joseph R. Biden Jr. settled down into a role as a statesman.
articles.abstract: After enduring a period of tumult in 1987, when he dropped a bid for president, Joseph R. Biden Jr. settled down into a role as a statesman.
articles.lead_paragraph: September 1987 was a month of ruin and renewal for Joe Biden.
articles.byline: By Patrick Healy and Michael Luo

articles.headline: Obama’s Pick Adds Foreign Expertise to Ticket
articles.snippet: In choosing Joseph R. Biden Jr. as his running mate, Barack Obama is adding a six-term senator known for his political skills, but also for occasionally talking himself into trouble.
articles.abstract: In choosing Joseph R. Biden Jr. as his running mate, Barack Obama is adding a six-term senator known for his political skills, but also for occasionally talking himself into trouble.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  Senator Barack Obama introduced Senator Joseph R. Biden Jr. as his running mate on Saturday at a boisterous rally in Springfield, Ill., a choice that strengthens the Democratic ticket’s credentials on foreign policy and provides Mr. Obama a combative partner as he heads into the fight with Senator John McCain.
articles.byline: By Adam Nagourney and Jeff Zeleny

articles.headline: Fear Keeps Iraqis Out of Their Baghdad Homes
articles.snippet: Even though sectarian killings in many areas of Iraq seem to have ended, the distrust they sowed lingers.
articles.abstract: Even though sectarian killings in many areas of Iraq seem to have ended, the distrust they sowed lingers.
articles.lead_paragraph: BAGHDAD  When Jabbar, an elderly Shiite man, stormed out of his house here in June wanting to know where all his furniture had gone, the sharp look of the young Sunni standing guard on his street stopped him cold.

articles.headline: U.S. and Global Economies Slipping in Unison
articles.snippet: The integrated global market spreads prosperity, but it also spreads hurt when times go bad.
articles.abstract: The integrated global market spreads prosperity, but it also spreads hurt when times go bad.
articles.lead_paragraph: Economic trouble has spread far beyond the United States to major countries in Europe and Asia, threatening American businesses with the loss of foreign sales and investment that have become increasingly vital to their sustenance.

articles.headline: That Student Loan, So Hard to Shake
articles.snippet: In the current economy, more borrowers may begin to discover the harrowing consequences of reneging on student loans.
articles.abstract: In the current economy, more borrowers may begin to discover the harrowing consequences of reneging on student loans.
articles.lead_paragraph: Tacoma, Wash.

articles.headline: What Will Mac ’n’ Mae Cost You and Me?
articles.snippet: Up and down Fannie’s and Freddie’s capital structure, debt and equity holders want to know how a bailout would affect them.
articles.abstract: Up and down Fannie’s and Freddie’s capital structure, debt and equity holders want to know how a bailout would affect them.
articles.lead_paragraph: THE inevitability of a taxpayer-funded bailout of Freddie Mac and Fannie Mae, the hobbled mortgage behemoths, shook investors last week, and shares in both companies plummeted on fears that existing stockholders would be wiped out.

articles.headline: Shift at the Top Emphasizes SAP’s Bottom Line
articles.snippet: Executive changes at the software maker SAP have fed an irresistible narrative in financial markets: the software egghead is yielding to the uncompromising money maker.
articles.abstract: Executive changes at the software maker SAP have fed an irresistible narrative in financial markets: the software egghead is yielding to the uncompromising money maker.
articles.lead_paragraph: WALLDORF, Germany — Henning Kagermann wants you to know that he is more than just a software geek.

articles.headline: A Campaign Not Filtered by the Press
articles.snippet: The Obama team’s direct approach: YouTube and text messages.
articles.abstract: The Obama team’s direct approach: YouTube and text messages.
articles.lead_paragraph: Denver

articles.headline: On TV, Timing Is Everything at the Olympics
articles.snippet: Getting U.S. stars like Michael Phelps to perform live in prime time was just one of the moves that set up the spectacular success NBC achieved in the Beijing Games.
articles.abstract: Getting U.S. stars like Michael Phelps to perform live in prime time was just one of the moves that set up the spectacular success NBC achieved in the Beijing Games.
articles.lead_paragraph: In mid-2005, Dick Ebersol, the chairman of NBC Sports, had secured the support of the International Olympic Committee for the critical move of the finals of the key television sports of swimming and gymnastics to morning hours in China so they could be shown live in prime time in the United States. But he had one more person he needed to consult: Michael Phelps.

articles.headline: Web Audience for Games Soars for NBC and Yahoo
articles.snippet: The extent to which the Internet served as a supplement to television was unprecedented, and there were two clear winners: NBC’s Web site and Yahoo’s Olympics section.
articles.abstract: The extent to which the Internet served as a supplement to television was unprecedented, and there were two clear winners: NBC’s Web site and Yahoo’s Olympics section.
articles.lead_paragraph: Steve Ferguson woke up early on Friday  3 a.m. to be exact  to watch his stepdaughter Margaux Isaksen, a 16-year-old Olympian, complete a grueling 11-hour performance in the modern pentathlon.

articles.headline: At the Fed, a Debate Over Countering Inflation Grows Louder
articles.snippet: Declining oil prices have eased inflationary pressures for the moment, but that hasn’t halted the Federal Reserve’s debate over whether to raise interest rates.
articles.abstract: Declining oil prices have eased inflationary pressures for the moment, but that hasn’t halted the Federal Reserve’s debate over whether to raise interest rates.
articles.lead_paragraph: JACKSON HOLE, Wyo.  With the decline in oil prices, inflationary pressures are easing for the moment. The Federal Reserve’s policy makers all acknowledge as much. But that has not halted their debate over whether to raise interest rates now to avoid higher inflation in the future.

articles.headline: Drilling Boom Revives Hopes for Natural Gas
articles.snippet: New technology is pushing down prices and reversing conventional wisdom that U.S. fields were in decline.
articles.abstract: New technology is pushing down prices and reversing conventional wisdom that U.S. fields were in decline.
articles.lead_paragraph: HOUSTON  American natural gas production is rising at a clip not seen in half a century, pushing down prices of the fuel and reversing conventional wisdom that domestic gas fields were in irreversible decline.

articles.headline: Holding Out, to Last Tiny Isle, as Cajun Land Sinks Into Gulf
articles.snippet: The Louisiana coast is sinking fast into the Gulf of Mexico, still its lifeblood but now also its nemesis.
articles.abstract: The Louisiana coast is sinking fast into the Gulf of Mexico, still its lifeblood but now also its nemesis.
articles.lead_paragraph: GOLDEN MEADOW, La.  The men still bark orders in a French patois here while at work along the banks of Bayou Lafourche, a watery main street whose lazy currents the color of smoky topaz flow south to other Cajun towns and the Gulf of Mexico.

articles.headline: In Nuclear Net’s Undoing, a Web of Shadowy Deals
articles.snippet: A tale of spies, moles and secret deals lies behind the undoing of Abdul Qadeer Khan’s nuclear black market.
articles.abstract: A tale of spies, moles and secret deals lies behind the undoing of Abdul Qadeer Khan’s nuclear black market.
articles.lead_paragraph: The president of Switzerland stepped to a podium in Bern last May and read a statement confirming rumors that had swirled through the capital for months. The government, he acknowledged, had indeed destroyed a huge trove of computer files and other material documenting the business dealings of a family of Swiss engineers suspected of helping smuggle nuclear technology to Libya and Iran.
articles.byline: By William J. Broad and David E. Sanger

articles.headline: Anxious Party Hopes to Show Strong Obama
articles.snippet: Democrats are urging Barack Obama to use the next four days to address weaknesses in his candidacy and lingering divisions from the primary fight.
articles.abstract: Democrats are urging Barack Obama to use the next four days to address weaknesses in his candidacy and lingering divisions from the primary fight.
articles.lead_paragraph: DENVER  Democrats gathering here for their nominating convention are significantly more nervous about Senator Barack Obama’s prospects this fall than they were a month ago, and are urging him to use the next four days to address weaknesses in his candidacy and lingering party divisions from the primary fight.

articles.headline: Blacks Debate Civil Rights Risk in Obama’s Rise
articles.snippet: Some black voters wonder if Barack Obama’s success will further the notion that the long struggle for racial equality has been won.
articles.abstract: Some black voters wonder if Barack Obama’s success will further the notion that the long struggle for racial equality has been won.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — On the night that Senator Barack Obama accepts the Democratic nomination for president, Roderick J. Harrison plans to pop open a bottle of Champagne and sit riveted before the television with his wife and 12-year-old son.

articles.headline: Home Sales Increased 3.1% in July
articles.snippet: The respite for the housing slump came as falling prices appeared to lure more buyers into the market, but the number of homes for sale increased significantly.
articles.abstract: The respite for the housing slump came as falling prices appeared to lure more buyers into the market, but the number of homes for sale increased significantly.
articles.lead_paragraph: More Americans waded into the housing market last month, lured by falling prices that helped send sales to their highest level since February.
